result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea Monique Lomack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 16CM121 and 05CF76.

Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: 16CM121 and 05CF76.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, school, or job training as available and as determined by the agent.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with any Festival Foods and any Walmart Market Place with out the consent of the agent. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
